message:
Hello,

We're looking at both Year 7 and [redacted name] entry for our daughters and want to understand how the school supports academic ambition across different age groups.

We’re also trying to plan financially, so could you send us your current termly fees and let us know whether there’s any bursary or scholarship support available?

Lastly, are visits or taster days available before applying?

Best regards,  
[redacted name]
reply: Dear [Redacted Name], Thank you for reaching out to us at More House School. We are delighted to hear of your interest in our school for both Year 7 and Sixth Form entry for your daughters. At More House, we are committed to supporting academic ambition across all age groups. Our curriculum is designed to challenge and inspire students, with personalised support embedded into each pupil's timetable. This ensures that every student can achieve her learning goals while we nourish her confidence and expand her potential. For Year 7, we are part of the London 11+ Consortium, which provides a fair and comprehensive assessment process, focusing on a child's potential in creative and critical thinking. In the Sixth Form, we offer a bespoke programme tailored to each learner's unique needs and aspirations. Regarding our fees, the current termly fees are structured to reflect the exceptional education and support we provide. For detailed information, I encourage you to visit our Admissions page, where you can find comprehensive details on our fee structure. We also offer a range of scholarships and bursaries to support excellence and provide financial assistance. Scholarships are available for academic achievement as well as in Music, Sport, Drama, and Art & Design, typically awarded at main entry points such as Year 7 and Lower Sixth. A limited number of bursaries are available for pupils joining Year 7, with special governors’ bursaries potentially awarded during the academic year. You can explore these options further in our Scholarships and Bursaries section. We warmly invite you to experience our school environment firsthand. We offer taster days for prospective students, allowing them to immerse themselves in our school culture and meet with our staff and students. Additionally, our Open Events page provides up-to-date information on upcoming opportunities to visit More House School. Should you have any further questions or wish to discuss your daughters' admissions journey, please do not hesitate to contact me directly. Warm regards, Mrs Powell De Caires Director of Admissions and Marketing More House School
